snippet: The case arose over a claim of molestation against the manager of a store on tribal land and whether a tribal court could rule in the suit.
abstract: Supreme Court justices hear arguments in appeal by Dollar General Corp over civil lawsuit in court of Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians; court appears poised to limit authority of Indian tribal courts over non-tribal members.
lead_paragraph: The case arose over a claim of molestation against the manager of a store on tribal land and whether a tribal court could rule in the suit.

headline.main: Justices Weigh Power of Indian Tribal Courts in Civil Suits
headline.print_headline: Justices Weigh the Role of Indian Tribal Courts in Suits Against Outsiders
